did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Marek Lehnert papers
did.abstract: Dispatches and sound recordings, relating to political conditions in Poland and to Vatican relations with Poland.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Marek Lehnert papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2002.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: RFE/RL broadcast records, Hoover Institution Archives
RFE/RL corporate records, Hoover Institution Archives

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Radio Free Europe correspondent in Rome.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Dispatches and sound recordings, relating to political conditions in Poland and to Vatican relations with Poland.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Radio broadcasting--Poland.

did.unittitle: Correspondence
RFE/RL Polish service transcripts
Solidarnosc file, transcripts
Correspondence
RFE/RL Polish service transcripts and correspondence
RFE/RL Polish service transcripts and clippings
Sound recordings of interviews and events
Sound recording of interview with Tadeusz Kondrusiewicz

scopecontent.p: Interview with Belarusian Roman Catholic Archbishop Tadeusz Kondrusiewicz, Apostolic Administrator of European Russia, during the Synod of Bishops in Rome. Kondrusiewicz describes the position of the Catholic Church in European Russia, its challenges and successes. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005849

did.unittitle: Sound recording of 4 PORY ROKU (Four Seasons) radio interview with Marek Lehnert

scopecontent.p: Side A: 4 Pory Roku (4 Seasons) radio interview with Marek Lehnert, in Italy, about his poems published by PSIK, Polish publishing house in Italy, founded by Polish immigrants Jacek and Maria Pałasiński, Nov 13, 1991; Radio Polonia in Rome, broadcast recording.

Side B: RADIO WOKY broadcast playing music. Selections include an instrumental rendition of the theme from M*A*S*H (Suicide Is Painless), January 26, 1989. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005850

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Henryk Kupiszewski and Professor Karolina Lanckorońska's award ceremony

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Henryk Kupiszewski, Polish Ambassador to the Vatican, discussing his planned trip to Poland to accompany John Paul II on his 4th pilgrimage, 25 May 1991.

Side B: Lanckorońska is being awarded one of Poland's highest orders, the Polonia Restituta (Order of Rebirth of Poland), for serving the cause of freedom and promoting Polish culture, 27 May 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005851

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Polish refugees in Rome

scopecontent.p: Polish immigrants talk about conditions in "Latina," an Italian transitional camp for refugees in Rome. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005852

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Karol Modzelewski and Henryk Muszyński

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Polish historian Karol Modzelewski, in Rome on 10 October 1990.
Side B: Interview with Archbishop Henryk Muszyński about 25th anniversary of Nostra Aetate in Rome, on 6 December 1990. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005853

did.unittitle: Sound recording of RFE broadcast "O nas samych" and interview with Marek Lehnert

scopecontent.p: Side A: "O Nas Samych" (About Ourselves) RFE broadcast, and interview with Marek Lehnert about his work as RFE Polish correspondent in Rome, 26 October 1985.
Side B: RFE broadcast "O Nas Samych", Marek Lehnert talks about the trial for the assassination of Pope John Paul II, 5 April 1986. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005854

did.unittitle: Sound recording of RFE broadcast from Lech Wałęsa's meeting with the Polish political émigré community in Paris
Sound recording of interviews with Stanisław Węglarz, Lech Wałęsa, and Edmund Jan Osmańczyk

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Węglarz about the Independent Trade Union "Solidarity" and upcoming elections in Poland, in Rome, May 24, 1989. Also includes "Cinema & Cinema" Film interview with Lech Wałęsa in Rome.
Side B: Interview with Polish journalist Edmund Osmańczyk about the 1989 legislative election in Poland, June 7, 1989, in Rome. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005858

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Józef Ślisz and Beniamino (Nino) Andreatta

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Ślisz, Chairman of Solidarity of Independent Farmers, during his visit to the Vatican, 25 September 1989.
Side B: Interview with Andreatta, 27 September 1989. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005862

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Pope John Paul II's visit to Lithuania

scopecontent.p: Side A: Pope John Paul II in Vilnius, Lithuania, mass for Poles, on September 7, 1993.
Side B: Interview with Archbishop Tadeusz Kondrusiewicz in September 1993. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005863

did.unittitle: Sound recording "Odjazd Władka" (Władek's departure)

scopecontent.p: Interview with Polish immigrants before their departure from a transitional camp for refugees in Italy, about their reasons for leaving Poland and expectations regarding their final destinations: Canada, Australia, and USA. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005865

did.unittitle: Sound recording of U3 Uchodźcy interviews of Polish refugees

scopecontent.p: Polish refugees in Italy talk about the interviews they had in Canadian, American, or Australian embassies in Rome, before being granted permission to legally emigrate to those countries. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005867

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Radio Vatican broadcast featuring Tadeusz Mazowiecki's meeting with Pope John Paul II

scopecontent.p: This Radio Vatican Polish section broadcast includes an announcement about Tadeusz Mazowiecki, Chairman of the Council of Ministers in Poland, who visited St. Peter's Basilica in Rome to meet with Pope John Paul II. In Polish. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005868

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Lech Wałęsa's visit to the Vatican

scopecontent.p: Welcoming speech to Wałęsa, president of Poland, who visited the Vatican and met with Pope John Paul II. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005870

did.unittitle: Sound recording of the Central European Initiative summit in Italy

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interviews with ministers of Poland and other European countries during the Central European Initiative summit in Italy.
Side B: Radio Vatican announcement about Pope John Paul II's trip to the African countries Benin, Uganda, and Sudan, February 3, 1993. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005871

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Jerzy Hordyński and Bishop Stanisław Stefanek

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Polish poet and writer Hordyński, July 16, 1992.
Side B: Interview with Stefanek about the assembly of bishops dedicated to Christian families, on 28 November, 1992. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005874

did.unittitle: Sound recording of the Primate's Social Council press conference and interviews with Bronisław Geremek and Adam Michnik

scopecontent.p: Side A: Press conference with the Primate's Social Council members visiting Rome: actor Andrzej Łapicki, Mochlińska, and others, February 27 1989.

Side B: Interview with Geremek and Michnik at the airport before leaving Rome about their visit in Italy and the political transformation in Poland, August 14 1989. Radio Vatican sound recording. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005875

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Radio Vatican Polish news broadcast: interview with Polish refugees before their departure to Australia

scopecontent.p: Side A: Radio Vatican Polish section news broadcast, including commentary about Pope John Paul II's visit to Bolivia, Peru, and Paraguay, also other news from Poland, 1988.

Side B: Interview with Polish refugees conducted at the airport before their departure to Australia, "Kubuś Jedzie do Australii." The family talks about their fifteen-month experience as refugees living in Italian transitional camp and expectations about their final destination of Australia. A young boy named Kubuś is excited about flying to Australia. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005879

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Lech Wałęsa in Florence

scopecontent.p: Interview with Polish president Wałęsa during his visit to Florence. He talks about his presidency and political and economic challenges awaiting Polish new post-communist democracy. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005880

did.unittitle: Sound recording of "Cinema & Cinema" radio broadcast featuring an interview with Lech Wałęsa

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Wałęsa on the "Cinema & Cinema" Italian radio station, with an Italian interpreter.
Side B: Radio Vatican broadcast. In Polish. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005992

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Radio Vatican Polish broadcast

scopecontent.p: Side A: Radio Vatican Polish broadcast: Archbishop Miroslav Marusyn, Secretary of the Congregation for the Eastern Churches. Also excerpts from liturgy of the Eucharist for Saint Adalbert (Ŝw.Wojciech) by Pope John Paul II, April 23 1988.

Side B: Radio Vatican Polish broadcast, 1988, including information on Catholic Church hierarchy in Poland and other news related to Pope John Paul II and Catholic Church. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005993

did.unittitle: Sound recording of "Podarunek od VI klasy" and interview with Lech Wałęsa

scopecontent.p: Side A: "Podarunek od VI klasy" (a gift from the sixth graders): interview with Polish 6th grader about a religious cross in his classroom in Poland, which he gave to Soviet delegation as a gift. the boy was later interrogated by the Polish Secret Service.
Side B: Interview with Wałęsa, January 15 1986. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005994

did.unittitle: Zbigniew Bujak sound recording

scopecontent.p: Side A: Zbigniew Bujak, "Solidarity" leader, at the Symposium on Prestroika in Rome, October 27 1989. Bujak talks about the "Solidarity" Trade Union and reforms in Poland.
Side B: Interview with Zbigniew Bujak, October 28 1989. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0005995

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Lech Wałęsa and Władysław Bartoszewski

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Polish President Wałęsa in Florence about upcoming parliamentary elections in Poland, October 22 1995; Cardinal Etchegaray.
Side B: Interview with Bartoszewski, Minister of Foreign Affairs in Poland, in Rome, 2-3 November 1995. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006003

did.unittitle: Obóz "Latina" sound recording

scopecontent.p: Side A: Obóz "Latina" ("Latina" camp), July 28, 1987. This is Lehnert's detailed report of his visit to camp "Latina," a transitional camp in Rome that is the temporary home for refugees of various countries, mostly from Poland, before they get permission to immigrate to countries of their final destination. Lehnert describes the camp's buildings and living conditions, he also interviews one Polish resident.
Side B: Polish mass in the camp's chapel, more interviews with Polish residents. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006004

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview of Lech Wałęsa visiting Rome

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Wałęsa and his speech during his visit to Rome, April 1989, where he met with Italian politicians and members of the democratic party: Benvenuto, Craxi, and Occhetto.

Side B: Speech by Piotr Nowina-Konopka, an assistant and spokesman for Wałęsa and Solidarity spokesman at the 1989 Round Table Agreement negotiations, on April 21 1989 in Rome. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006006

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Władysław Frasyniuk and Janusz Pałubicki

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Frasyniuk and Pałubicki, Polish politicians, activists of Solidarity trade union, during their visit in Rome
Side B: Radio Vatican Polish Section broadcast. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006007

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Krzysztof Zanussi and Jerzy Hordyński

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Zanussi, Polish film director and producer, during his visit in Rome, October 2 1990, about cinematography and TV production in Poland during transformation period. Zanussi also recalls recently deceased Italian novelist and journalist Alberto Moravia.

Side B: Interview with Polish poet and writer Hordyński, who talks about recently deceased popular Italian novelist and journalist Alberto Moravia, from October 3 1990; Pope John Paul II on abortion. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006010

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Adam Michnik and Konstanty Gebert (Dawid Warszawski)

scopecontent.p: Side A: Michnik, prominent "Solidarity" activist and dissident, speaks during a panel discussion about political and democratic transformation in Poland and other Eastern European countries, October 28 1989.

Side B: Interview with Gebert (pseudonym Dawid Warszawski), Polish journalist and Jewish activist, October 29 1989. Gebert talks about the new government in Poland, established after Round Table negotiations and democratic elections, and emerging challenges and problems in new political landscape. He emphasizes the new role and responsibilities of the press in Poland. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006011

did.unittitle: Uchodźcy (refugees) sound recording (Part 4)

scopecontent.p: Interview with Polish refugees about possibilities and conditions of returning to their homeland, in light of recent political events there, recognition of Solidarity and economic and social circumstances in Poland. All interviewees do not believe in true reforms and are convinced that they made the right decision by leaving Poland. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006012

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Jacek Woźniakowski and Stefan Frankiewicz

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Professor Woźniakowski, Polish art historian, writer, journalist, member of the Citizens' Committee of Solidarity and first elected president of Krakow after the collapse of communism. As correspondent of the Catholic newspaper "Universal Weekly," Woźniakowski talks about the symposium at the Vatican in which he gave a speech about changes in post-communist Poland, especially the role of Church.

Side B: Interview with Professor Frankiewicz, Polish historian, journalist, ambassador to Vatican, and Chief Editor of Catholic monthly "Więź"(Bond). Frankiewicz talks about the symposium where he spoke on religion and culture in uniting post-communist Europe. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006013

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Piero Schiavazzi and Piotr Konopka

scopecontent.p: Side A: Italian journalist Schiavazzi talks about "Persona TV" (recording in Italian).

Side B: Nowina-Konopka, Polish politician, assistant and spokesman for Lech Wałęsa, leader of the Solidarity movement, talks about his work with Wałęsa and the Round Table Negotiations. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006016

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Interview with Archbishop Henryk Muszyński and Lech Wałęsa

scopecontent.p: Side A: Archbishop Muszyński talks about council preparatory sessions for an upcoming 1994 Synod in Rome. Interview conducted on July 1 1994.
Side B: Wałęsa talks on an Italian radio program, 1994 (questions in Italian); Pope John Paul II greets pilgrims from different countries in Rome. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006017

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Andrzej Stelmachowski and Maja Komorowska

scopecontent.p: Side A: Andrzej Stelmachowski, Marshal of the Senate, talks about pilgrimages of John Paul II to Poland, elections and political scene in Poland, also role of Polish diaspora in Western countries, 15 March 1990.

Side B: Interview with Polish actress and teacher Maja Komorowska about the theater festival in Rome and challenges for new actors in politically transforming Poland, 17 May 1990. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006018

did.unittitle: TG1 Speciale 3 radio station sound recording

scopecontent.p: Label reads: TG1 SPECIALE (3) 15.I.87. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006021

did.unittitle: Sound recording of an interview with Jerzy Urban and a reading of the novel "Potop" (part I)

scopecontent.p: Side A: Urban, journalist, reporter, and a Polish government spokesperson from 1981 to 1989, talks about positive political and economic changes in Poland, also the ruling communist party's dialogue with the "Solidarity" movement and opposition. The interview was conducted during Urban's visit to Rome, December 9, 1988.
Side B: "Potop," a patriotic historical novel by Polish writer Henryk Sienkiewicz, part I. The novel is read by actors from radio program. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006023

did.unittitle: Sound recording Praca (work) of interviews with Polish immigrants

scopecontent.p: This interview with Polish immigrants is about finding work while staying in a transitional camp in Rome, Italy. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006026

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Slovak politician Alexander Dubček accepting an honorary doctorate from Bologna University in Italy
Sound recording of interviews with Tadeusz Kantor and Alicja Grześkowiak

scopecontent.p: Side A: Tadeusz Kantor, Polish artist, painter, set designer and theater director, talks about his attitude toward culture and art in politically transformed Poland, during his visit to Rome in June 1990. Kantor describes new challenges facing artists in Poland, especially in the "theatrical world."
Side B: Interview with Grześkowiak, member of Polish Senate, during her diplomatic visit to Rome in 1990 June. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006028

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Henryk Kupiszewski

scopecontent.p: Side A: Professor Kupiszewski, Polish ambassador to the Vatican, talks about changes and new perspectives on a global scale after reinstating diplomatic relations between Poland and the Vatican. He points out the important role of Pope John Paul II's recent visit to Poland.
Side B: Italian actor Alberto Sordi, 1990. In Italian. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006029

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Professor Włodzimierz Mokry and Marek Król

scopecontent.p: Side A: Mokry, a Polish professor of Ukrainian origin and member of Parliament, talks about Ukraine and other former Soviet republics' national identities and the future of the Russian Federation.
Side B: Interview with Król, Polish journalist, activist of the Communist Party, former editor of "Wprost,"and member of Parliament. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006111

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Marek Lehnert speaking about the Pontificia Academia Ecclesiastica (Pontifical Academy of Church) in Rome

scopecontent.p: Founded in 1706, this elite Church Academy specializes in Vatican Diplomacy. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006112

did.unittitle: Sound recording of a Radio Vatican broadcast concerning Pope John Paul II's stay in the Gemelli Polyclinic

scopecontent.p: Report concerns the Pope's health. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006113

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Josip Terelja and other Catholic Church leaders at a press conference

scopecontent.p: Side A: Terelja, Lay Leader of Ukrainian Catholics, at a press conference in Rome. Terelja spent many years in Soviet prisons and psychiatric hospitals because of his campaign for recognition of the rights of Ukrainian Catholics. Italian radio broadcast.
Side B: Press conference with leaders of Ukrainian Catholic Church at the Vatican. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006114

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews of Professor Bronisław Geremek and Cardinal Henryk Gulbinowicz

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Polish historian and politician Geremek, during his visit to Rome, 18 January 1991. Geremek talks about Polish reaction to the recent outbreak of war in the Middle East, also Polish-Russian political and economic relations.
Side B: Interview with Gulbinowicz about the role of the Catholic Church in post-communist Poland, 29 January 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006116

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Władysław Frasyniuk and Janusz Pałubicki

scopecontent.p: Interview with Frasyniuk, politician, former activist of Solidarity Trade Union, member of Polish parliament, and Pałubicki, Polish politician and activist, during their visit to Rome, 14 July 1989. They discuss the need for economic reforms in a free-market-economy Poland, ways of improving the standard of living, and decreasing the identity and role of "Solidarity" Free Union. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006117

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Professor Jacek Woźniakowski and Piotr Nowina-Konopka

scopecontent.p: Side A: Professor Woźniakowski, Polish art historian, novelist, journalist, member of the Citizens' Committee to the President of Trade Union "Solidarity," comments on Polish reaction to Pope John Paul II's recent address, and political and economic reforms in Poland.

Side B: Nowina-Konopna, spokesman for Solidarity leader Lech Wałęsa and Solidarity spokesman at the 1989 Round Table Agreement negotiations, talks about the political scene in Poland. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006118

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview of Father Ivan Dacko

scopecontent.p: Dacko, aUkrainian Greek Catholic priest, served as patriarchal chancellor of the Ukrainian Catholic Church based in Rome. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006119

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Konrad Hejmo and Grzegorz Gałązka

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Hejmo, Polish Catholic priest, assistant to the general and special audiences of Pope John Paul II. Hejmo talks about the challenges of arranging audiences for Polish pilgrims after the Pope's illness and surgery in July 1992.

Side B: Gałązka, official photographer of Pope John Paul II, comments on the Pope's recent trip to the mountains after his illness and hospitalization. Gałązka accompanied Pope during his trip. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006121

did.unittitle: Sound recording of a performance by Roberto Begnigni and of Lech Wałęsa's first official visit to Rome as Polish president

scopecontent.p: Side A: recording of Italian singer Lucio Dalla and Italian actor Robert Begnigni, in "Attenti Al Lupo" (Peter and the Wolf), 1991.

Side B: Wałęsa's first official visit to Rome as Polish president, 4 February 1991. Andrzej Drzycimski, Wałęsa's spokesman, talks about the importance of each meeting between Pope John Paul II and Wałęsa's. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006122

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Lech Wałęsa's visit to Rimini, Italy
Sound recording of Liliana Cavani, Vittorio Taviani, and Gian Luigi Rondi, and Eduard Shevardnadze

scopecontent.p: Side A: Italian filmmakers Liliana Cavani, Vittorio Taviani, and Gian Luigi Rondi talk about Polish cinema, Rome, February 19, 1991. In Italian.

Side B: Eduard Shevardnadze, Georgia's head of state, comments on the impact of Perestroika on the Soviet Union and other countries. In Russian, with Italian interpreter. Samarcanda, 14 March 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006126

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Italian radio broadcast about Polish refugees in Italy

scopecontent.p: In Italian; includes translated statements by Polish refugees. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006127

did.unittitle: Sound recording at "Latina," a transitional camp for refugees in Rome and interview with Polish refugees

scopecontent.p: The refugees primarly discuss the camp's living conditions. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006128

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Archbishop Szczepan Wesoły, Cardinal Józef Glemp, and Tadeusz Mazowiecki

scopecontent.p: Side A: At a conference in Rome about Polish immigration: (1) Polish Cardinal Glemp talks about the role and spiritual presence of Roman Catholic Church; (2) Polish Archbishop Wesoły, pastor of immigrants, lecture about Polish immigration after WWII.

Side B: Tadeusz Mazowiecki, first non-communist Prime Minister of Poland, calling for cooperation between Poland and Polish immigrants scattered all over the world. Senator Anna Bogucka lecture about identity of Polish immigrants with Polish culture around the world. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006130

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Polish pilgrims in Santiago de Compostela, Spain

scopecontent.p: Hiszpania. At a key destination of Christian pilgrimages, the recording includes greetings by Pope John Paul II and interviews with young Polish pilgrims. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006131

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Lech Wałęsa and Bishop Tadeusz Pieronek

scopecontent.p: Side A: Short interview of Wałęsa, 27 August 1990.
Side B: Interview with Polish Bishop Tadeusz Pieronek, 25 October 1993. Pope John Paul II appeal to Poles, Rome, 1993. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006132

did.unittitle: Sound recording of an interview with Marian Jurczyk

scopecontent.p: Jurczyk, Polish politician and Solidarity trade union activist, talks about his political activities and repressions in Poland. Jurczyk elaborates on the demoralization among youth in Poland, caused by lack of perspectives; he also comments on the necessity of implementing political and economic reforms in Poland. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006133

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews of Józef Ŝlisz, Janusz Onyszkiewicz, and Andrzej Malanowski

scopecontent.p: Side A: Ŝlisz, Deputy Speaker of the Senate and a longtime leader of "Solidarity of Individual Farmers," reflects on his visit to Parma.

Side B: Lecture by Onyszkiewicz, member of the Polish Parliament, about the history of the "Solidarity" movement in Poland. Also includes an interview (in Italian) with Maria Macciocchi, Italian feminist militant and leftist dissident, and interview of Andrzej Malanowski, Polish Socialist Party (PPS), about political parties in new democratic Poland. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006249

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Polish women living in Africa, made during Pope John Paul II's visit to Africa
Sound recording of Bogusław Steczek and Professor Krzysztof Żaboklicki

scopecontent.p: Side A: Steczek, Assistant General of the Jesuits for Central and Eastern Europe, liaison between John Paul II and the Church and and the Jesuits in these countries, talks about the Catholic community and Jesuit mission in Russia. Rome, 9 March 1992.

Side B: Żaboklicki, President of International Union of the Institutes of Archaeology, History and Art History in Rome, talks about the presence of Italian culture in Central Europe and Polish culture in Italy, 8 April 1992. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006251

did.unittitle: Sound recording of an interview with Archbishop Kazimierz Swiatek and a meeting of Marek Edelman with the Polish community in Rome

scopecontent.p: Światek, Vatican Archbishop of Minsk, Belarus, discusses his work in a mission in Belarus, 12 December 1991.
Side B: Edelman, last surviving leader of the Warsaw Ghetto uprising of 1943, meets with the Polish community in Rome, 17 December 1991 (part I). Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006252

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Krzysztof Małachowski and Marek Edelman

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Father Małachowski, from Eucharistic Apostolate Foundation for Disabled Children: "Dzieci Dzieciom" (from Children to Children).
Side B: Edelman interview in Rome (part II). Edelman talks about the Jewish nation, culture, and Israeli-Palestinian relations. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006254

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Bishop Józef Michalik interview

scopecontent.p: Side A: Michalik, while attending the Synod of Bishops for Europe in Rome, talks about the role of the Catholic Church in Poland. Also included is a Radio Vatican broadcast about the 1991 elections in Poland, and Pope John Paul II's visit to Poland.
Side B: Michalik discusses the Synod of Bishops for Europe in Rome. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006255

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews of Adam Żak and Professor Jacek Woźniakowski, 13 Jan 1992

scopecontent.p: Side A: Żak, Kraków, a Jesuit priest, reflects on religious consciousness, Rome, 8 January 1992.
Side B: Woźniakowski, Polish historian and writer, talks about social teachings of the Church, 13 January 1992. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006256

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Józef Mirosław Życiński

scopecontent.p: Życiński, Polish Roman Catholic bishop, philosopher, theologian, journalist, and the diocesan bishop of Tarnów, talks about the European Synod in Rome. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006257

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Bishop Antoni Pacyfik Dydycz interview

scopecontent.p: Dydycz (religious name: Pacyfik), Polish diocesan bishop of Drohiczyn, OFM Cap (Order of Friars Minor Capuchin), Doctor of History, discusses evangelism in Eastern European countries. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006258

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Polish priests from the missionary congregation "Werbiści," Flores Island

scopecontent.p: Polish priests from Werbiści, Divine Word, the missionary congregation SDV (from Lat. Societas Divini Verbi), talk about their mission in Indonesia and challenges they encounter there. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006259

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Bishop Sławoj Leszek Głódź, 8 Feb 1992 and Father Stanisław Pomykała, 12 Dec 1992

scopecontent.p: Side A: Polish Catholic Bishop Głódź is interviewed about his participation in the conference of bishops of different faiths in Vatican. He also reflects on his experience as the Field Bishop of the Polish Army since 1991. 8 February 1992.
Side B: Pomykała, a Catholic Priest, talks about his mission and work in Novosibirsk and Tomsk, Russia. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006260

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Cardinal Andrzej Maria Deskur and Bishop Ryszard Karpiński

scopecontent.p: Side A: Cardinal Deskur, President of the Pontifical Council for Social Communications, reflects on the essence and power of human suffering, 17 February 1992.
Side B: Bishop Karpiński talks about shrines, pilgrimages, and priests serving Poles who live in the former Soviet Union, 2 March 1992. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006261

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews of Rocco Buttiglione and Cardinal Fiorenzo Angelini

scopecontent.p: Side A: Buttiglione, Italian Christian Democrat politician, interview, 7 January 1994. In Italian.
Side B: Italian Cardinal Angelini is interviewed about popular place of pilgrimages in Poland, Częstochowa, 2 February 1994. In Italian. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006262

did.unittitle: Sound recording of a family, interview with Adam Edward Boniecki, and Italian radio broadcast with Lech Wałęa

scopecontent.p: Side A: Family sound recording, 29 January 1991.

Side B: Boniecki, a Catholic priest, talks about the ministry of Polish diocean bishop of Przemyśl - Ignacy Tokarczuk, 2 February 1991. Also includes an Italian radio broadcast with Lech Wałęa interview, 3 February 1991 (in Italian). Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006263

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Tadeusz Mazowiecki press conference and RFE interview with Tadeusz Mazowiecki

scopecontent.p: Side A: Mazowiecki, Polish prime minister, press conference, Rome, 15 May 1991. Side B: Mazowiecki interview, 17 May 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006264

did.unittitle: Sound recording of debate about Father Jerzy Popiełuszko and General Wojciech Jaruzelski

scopecontent.p: Debate in Rome hosted by Italian Magazine Mondoperaio (World Worker). In Italian. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006265

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews of Professor Andrzej Stelmachowski, Wojciech Jaruzelski and Lech Wałęsa

scopecontent.p: Side A: Stelmachowski, Polish academic and politician, is interviewed about Individual Farmers Union "Solidarity" in Poland, 21 February 1989.
Side B: Italian radio broadcast featuring interviews with Jaruzelski, 31 May 1988, and Wałęsa, 13 March 1989. Translated from Polish into Italian. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006266

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Professor Jerzy Kłoczowski conversation from 6 May 1988 and reports about strikes in Poland

scopecontent.p: Side A: Conversation by telephone with a witness to demonstrations in Poland, about the wave of strikes and rallies that erupted in Polish factories and colleges in the spring of 1988, followed by arrests and other repressions; the potesters' demands included re-legalization of the "Solidarity" movement and other political reforms in Poland.
Side B: Interview with Kłoczowski, a historian, who talks about the legacy of Kievan Ruthenia in the Polish-Lithuanian-Russian community, 6 May 1988. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006269

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Włodzimierz Cimoszewicz, Archbishop Jean-Louis Pierre Tauran, and Stefan Frankiewicz

scopecontent.p: Side A: Prime minister of Poland Cimoszewicz talks about the EU summit in Florence and hopes for Poland to be ready to join the EU by 2000, 22 June 1996.

Side B: French Archbishop Jean-Louis Pierre Tauran, Secretary of State of Vatican, talks about the concordat between Poland and Vatican, 24 July 1996. In French. Also includes Radio Vatican broadcast interview with Stefan Frankiewicz, Polish Ambassador to Vatican, 24 July 1996. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006270

did.unittitle: 50 years of Radio Vatican sound recording

scopecontent.p: Celebratory program with guests and speakers: Bishop Zenon Grocholewski and directors of Polish section, as well as several priests: Florian Pełka, Franciszek Mączyński, Stefan Filipowicz, and Ludwik Grzebień. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006273

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews of Florian Pełka and Tomáŝ Ŝpidlik

scopecontent.p: Side A: Father Pełka is interviewed about Congregation of Jesuits, 21 December 1994.
Side B: Ŝpidlik, a Czech catholic priest, talks about his recollections in the Vatican, 25 March 1995. In Italian. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006274

did.unittitle: Sound recording of RFE broadcasts "In the intention of the homeland and those who suffer" and "Precious death"

scopecontent.p: Side A: "In the intention of the homeland and those who suffer" broadcast about Father Jerzy Popiełuszko.
Side B: "Precious death" with homily by Father Franciszek Blachnicki. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006275

did.unittitle: Sound recording of radio broadcast "Testament of Father Jerzy Popiełuszko" radio broadcast

scopecontent.p: Side A: International Center of Evangelization "Light-Life" broadcast titled "Testament of Father Jerzy Popiełuszko" from recording studio in Carlsberg. It includes a recording of Popiełuszko's last sermon before he was kidnapped and murdered by the Polish Security Service in October 1984.
Side B: Father Franciszek Blachnicki, "In the Face of Crime: Testament of Father Jerzy Popiełuszko." Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006276

did.unittitle: Radio Vatican sound recording "Ksiądz Jerzy Popiełuszko o swej pracy"

scopecontent.p: This is about the work of Popiełuszko. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006280

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Cardinal Józef Glemp interview

scopecontent.p: Side A: Glemp interview, 7 July 1995.
Side B: News broadcast in Italian. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006281

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Tadeusz Michałek interview

scopecontent.p: Side A: Michałek, a priest, talks about his missionary journeys to the United States and Malta, emphasizing the importance of contact and dialogue with the followers of different faiths. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006282

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Cardinal Józef Glemp interview
Sound recording of Konrad Hejmo, Janusz Pasierb, and Jacek Moskwa

scopecontent.p: Side A: Hejmo, a Dominican priest, is interviewed on 15 July 1991.

Side B: Pasierb, a priest, poet and historian, talks about the role of church in the Polish culture, and journalist and writer Jacek Moskwa talks about priest Jan Zieja, 30 October 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006286

did.unittitle: Sound recording of radio broadcast about General Wojciech Jaruzelski and report on Solidarity trade union demands from Gdańsk

scopecontent.p: Side A: Radio broadcast about Jaruzelski, 31 June 1988. In Italian.
Side B: Report concerning a list of demands published by the Solidarity trade union strike committee, and an interview with Adam Michnik. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006287

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview of Halina Mikołajska, a Polish actress
Sound recording of Pope John Paul II's pilgrimage to Poland

scopecontent.p: Side A: Pope John Paul II during pilgrimage to Poland, recorded at a church and a theater, 9 June 1991; impressions and comments by actors, writers, politicians: Andrzej Szczypiorski, Paweł Hertz, Wiktor Woroszylski, Maja Komorowska, Andrzej Stelmachowski, Father Janusz Pasierb, Ernest Bryll, Stefan Bratkowski, and others.
Side B: John Paul II visits a Jewish Theater during his pilgrimage, June 9 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006290

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Cardinal Andrzej Maria Deskur and Stefan Wilkanowicz

scopecontent.p: Side A: Cardinal Deskur expresses his wishes on the 40th anniversary of Polish Section of RFE. Vatican Radio news broadcast.
Side B: Wilkanowicz, a journalist, discusses a meeting of the Council for the Laity in Rome. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006291

did.unittitle: Sound recording of a conversation with Latvian Cardinal Julijans Vaivods
Sound recording of refugees interview with Władysław Siła-Nowicki

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Polish refugees in Rome, 1989.
Side B: Interview of Solidarity adviser and longtime anti-communist lawyer Władysław Siła-Nowicki, 18 February 1989. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006297

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview of Tadeusz Mazowiecki and Polish bishops about the 1994 Synod in Rome

scopecontent.p: Mazowiecki arrived in Rome as a Special Emissary of United Nations Organization to Bosnia and Herzegovina. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006298

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Archbishop Tadeusz Kondrusiewicz, Bishop Stanisław Nagy, and Krzysztof Skubiszewski

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interviews with Belarusian archbishop Kondrusiewicz and Bishop Nagy, 6 December 1992.
Side B: Polish Minister of Foreign Affairs Skubiszewski interview, 3 July 1993. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006299

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Cardinal Józef Glemp and Krzysztof Skubiszewski

scopecontent.p: Side A: Cardinal Glemp, 4 July 1990.
Side B: Polish Minister of Foreign Affairs Skubiszewski press conference, Rome, 7 July 1990. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006300

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interviews with Professor Bronisław Geremek and Andrzej Niemierko

scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Geremek, a Polish historian and politician, Rome, 9 August 1989.

Side B: Interview with Niemierko, an engineer and intern of IRI (The Istituto per la Ricostruzione Industriale/Industrial Reconstruction Institute), Rome, 9 June 1990. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006301

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Krzysztof Skubiszewski and Leszek Balcerowicz

scopecontent.p: Side A: Skubiszewski, Polish Minister of Foreign Affairs, Rome, 7 July 1990.
Side B: Polish Finance Minister Balcerowicz press conference, Rome, 19 October 1990. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006302

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Krzysztof Skubiszewski

scopecontent.p: This interview of the Polish Minister of Foreign Affairs was conducted in Rome. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006304

did.unittitle: Václav Havel sound recording

scopecontent.p: President of the Czech Republic Havel, Dahrendorf, C. M. Martini. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006305

did.unittitle: Sound recording of interview with Marini

scopecontent.p: Marini, Pizzinato, Benvenuto, is interviewed after his meeting with General Wojciech Jaruzelski. In Italian. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006307

did.unittitle: Sound recording of "Country-Emigration" conference

scopecontent.p: Side A: The conference recording includes an interview with a Polish priest from Uzbekistan, Józef Świdnicki, and one of the organizers of the conference, Orłowski.
Side B: Andrzej Stelmachowski, Marshal of the Senate, addresses the conference and Polish diaspora. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006308

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Salvatore Esposito and Father Janusz Pasierb

scopecontent.p: Side A: Salvatore Esposito, student of writer Jerzy Pomianowski.
Side B: Father Janusz Pasierb in Rome, 5 August 1990. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006368

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Andrzej Szostek and Bishop Bronisław Dembowski

scopecontent.p: Side A: Polish priest and professor Andrzej Szostek, MIC, talks about about the Veritatis Splendor ("The Splendor of Truth"), an encyclical by Pope John Paul II, Rome, 5 October 1993.
Side B: Bishop Dembowski talks about elections, Rome, 1993. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006369

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Konrad Hejmo and Ambassador Henryk Kupiszewski

scopecontent.p: Side A: Dominican priest Konrad Hejmo talks about the pilgrimage movement, 11 January 1991.
Side B: Ambassador Kupiszewski is interviewed after meeting with Pope John Paul II, 12 January 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006370

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Szczepan Praśkiewicz, Professor Maria Poprzęcka and Professor Jan Ostrowski

scopecontent.p: Side A: Carmelite theologian Father Praśkiewicz talks about Saint Rafał Kalinowski, the Carmelite beatified by Pope John Paul II, 6 November 1991.

Side B: Professor Poprzęcka, Polish art historian and director of the Institute of Art History at Warsaw University, and Professor Ostrowski, Polish art historian at the Jagiellonian University Art History Institute and director of the Royal Castle, 14 November 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006371

did.unittitle: Bishop Józef Mirosław Życiński sound recording
Sound recording of Litwa-Łotwa (Lithuania-Latvia) from Aglona, Latvia
Sound recording of Cardinal Myrosław I. Lubaczywski and Bishop Ivan Martyniak

scopecontent.p: side A. Ukrainian Cardinal Lubaczywski, Rome, 10 December 1991.
Side B. Martyniak, bishop for Polish Ukrainian Catholics in Przemyśl from Rome, 11 December 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006374

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Cardinal Józef Glemp and Cardinal Edmund Szoka

scopecontent.p: Side A: Glemp, Polish cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church, talks about the Consistory (General Assembly of the cardinals) in the Vatican, 13-14 June 1994.
Side B: Szoka discusses Vatican finances, 30 June 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_00062375

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Mario Segni, Cardinal Agostino Casaroli, and Cardinal Józef Glemp

scopecontent.p: Side A: Italian politician Mario Segni and Cardinal Agostino Casaroli, 13 December 1993 and 20 December 1993.
Side B: Cardinal Glemp, 20 Jan 1994. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006376

did.unittitle: Angola sound recordings
Sound recordings from Pope John Paul II's trip to Africa

scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Press conference with Pope John Paul II on board an aircraft during the flight to Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Also includes ceremony at the airport, 1 September 1990.
Tape 2: Singing before the mass in Dar es Salaam, Polish missionaries, a conversation with a priest about AIDS, and singing in St. Peter's church.
Tape 3: Poles in Songea and Mwanza, 3 September 1990, a Franciscan in Moshi, and the Burundi national anthem, 5 September 1990.
Tape 4: Polish Carmelite missionaries in Burundi, and Pope John Paul II addresses Poles in Bujumbura, 6 September 1990.
Tape 5: Welcoming ceremony in Rwanda, 7 September 1990, Archbishop Henryk Hoser talks about AIDS, Kigali, 7 September 1990.
Tape 6: Tam-tams, Carmelite missionaries in Kigali, Rwanda, 8 September 1990.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Father Lewandowski and Roman Rota

scopecontent.p: Side A: Lewandowski talks about the catechism, July 1992.
Side B: Rota Rzymska (Roman Rota, the highest appellate tribunal of the Roman Catholic Church). Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006385

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Poles in Mauritius

scopecontent.p: Side A: Poles in Mauritius, 15 October 1989.
Side B: Flight from Mauritius to Rome, 16 October 1989. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006386

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Poles in Malta
Sound recording from Wrocław and of Cardinal Henryk Gulbinowicz

scopecontent.p: Side A: Wrocław, Poland, March 1990.
Side B: Cardinal Gulbinowicz in Rome, 4 April 1990. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006390

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Pope John Paul II leaving the hospital and Father Michał Heller

scopecontent.p: Side A: The Pope leaves the hospital, 28 July 1992.
Side B: Father Heller talks about the Pontifical Academy of Sciences, 31 October 1992. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006392

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Father Henryk Hoser and radio broadcast including interview with a primate (bishop)

scopecontent.p: Side A: Hoser, 12 December 1992.
Side B: Radio broadcast Kościół i Świat (Church and the World), which includes an interview with a primate (bishop), 1 January 1993. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006393

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Marek Lehnert reporting from a refugee camp in Latina, Italy

Sound recording of Sister Akwina Filipowicz

Side B: Bishop Ignacy Tokarczuk, 6 December 1990. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006400

Side B: Roman Rota (part II). Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006406

scopecontent.p: Side A: Heller in the Vatican, 4 October 1991.
Side B: Wałęsa and Jankowski in Rome, 6 October 1991. Use copy reference number: 2002c12_a_0006408
